::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE)
```
:::

## Dataset description
This data set shows Air BnB in New York Cit in 2019 with 16 variables and 48,895 rows. The variables includes NYC neighborhood and neighborhood group, type of rental (entire home, private room, shared room), their prices, the minimum required number of nights, and number of guest reviews.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
 AB_NYC_2019 <- read.csv("_data/AB_NYC_2019.csv")
 dim(AB_NYC_2019)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 48895    16
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
colnames(AB_NYC_2019)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] "id"                             "name"                          
 [3] "host_id"                        "host_name"                     
 [5] "neighbourhood_group"            "neighbourhood"                 
 [7] "latitude"                       "longitude"                     
 [9] "room_type"                      "price"                         
[11] "minimum_nights"                 "number_of_reviews"             
[13] "last_review"                    "reviews_per_month"             
[15] "calculated_host_listings_count" "availability_365"              
```
:::
:::

:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
AB_NYC_2019 %>% 
    select( "room_type",  "neighbourhood", "price", everything())%>%
    group_by(room_type) %>%
    summarise(avg_price = mean(price, na.rm = TRUE))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 2
  room_type       avg_price
  <chr>               <dbl>
1 Entire home/apt     212. 
2 Private room         89.8
3 Shared room          70.1
```
:::
:::

##TIDY DATASET

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
AB_NYC_2019 %>% 
  select(-c("id","host_id","host_name","last_review","calculated_host_listings_count" )) %>%
  print(AB_NYC_2019)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error}
```
Error in print.default(m, ..., quote = quote, right = right, max = max): invalid printing digits -2147483648
```
:::
:::

#Visualization univarate

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
  ggplot(AB_NYC_2019,aes(price))+
  geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](KhadijatAdeleye_Hw5_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Price ggplot
ggplot(data,aes(x="Price_Property")) + geom_bar(position = "dodge", stat = "count", fill="orange", colour="blue") +
  labs (title = "NYC AirBnB Property Prices in 2019", x = "Price of Property", y = "Count of Properties")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error}
```
Error in `ggplot()`:
! `data` cannot be a function.
ℹ Have you misspelled the `data` argument in `ggplot()`
```
:::
:::

###neighbourhood group

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
AB_NYC_2019 %>%
  ggplot(aes(neighbourhood_group,price))+
  geom_boxplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](KhadijatAdeleye_Hw5_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
AB_NYC_2019 %>%
  ggplot(aes(number_of_reviews,neighbourhood_group,))+
  geom_point()+
  facet_wrap(vars(neighbourhood_group))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](KhadijatAdeleye_Hw5_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

###number of review

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
  AB_NYC_2019 %>%
  ggplot(aes(price, number_of_reviews))+
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](KhadijatAdeleye_Hw5_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
